answers.answer: A coworker of mine has gestational diabetes. She has had more ultrasounds than me.Dr says its because babies are likely to be born bigger than average and simply need more monitoring.Good luck and hope your baby is wekk.

question: So I had a ultrasound at 30 weeks and was told my baby was measuring perfectly fine and everything was good, the reason they did an ultrasound was bc I have gestational diabetes and well they referred me to a fetal specialist bc I have gestational diabetes but I'm confuse why I have to go if my Ultrasound came back perfect does anybody know why ?
title: Confuse ?
